title: Spy Satellites and Mapping
description: A quick win: understand Spy Satellites and Mapping.

hook.text: During the Cold War, the US launched secret satellites that photographed every inch of the Soviet Union.

buildup.text: The Corona program dropped canisters of film from orbit. Planes snagged them mid-air with a hook.

discovery.text: These photos mapped more of Earth in weeks than ground surveyors had mapped in a century.

twist.text: When declassified in 1995, scientists used them to track glacier retreat and deforestation over 40 years.

climax.text: Today, commercial satellites can photograph objects as small as 12 inches from 400 miles up.

punchline.text: Cold War spy photos became climate science data.

quiz.question: How did the Corona spy satellite program retrieve its photos?
options: Film canisters dropped from orbit and caught mid-air
